intro: Antillanthus leucolepis, commonly known as the white-leaved antillanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a waxy, white-veined appearance. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands.
